p.s: I don't know what to say.
I've got no one to talk to, neither my mother nor my uncle, I pushed them all away.
What am I even doing?
I can't believe how I behaved today.
Even though I must admit that it felt good to finally say what's on my mind.
I know that I was in a rage, but I couldn't believe what my uncle did to aunt Emily.
Because of behaviour like that, people are afraid of us and think that we're terrorists.
Uncle Amir has always acted so mature and rational in front of me.
I turn 23 next year, when was he going to stop thinking of me like a naive teenager?
I can't take all those weird looks and comments anymore.
But there is one thing that I'm sure of: I'm not going to end up like my uncle.
Because of his coward behaviour, he lost everything and everyone in his life.
It is in our hand, in the hands of the young generation to achieve what the ones before us were too afraid to fight for: justice.
There is no way, that I will hide who I am my whole life, like my uncle did.
The weight of my voice is not going to be less if it is Hussein speaking and not Abe.
But honestly, how are people like the FBIFederal Bureau of Investigation authorities even surprised?
If they keep shaking us off the edges of society and treat us like a lower class, how are they not surprised that we switch sides to where we fell accepted?
I know that what I've said was over the line.
Still, I do intend to fight.
Not with weapons, but with my voice as an immigrated, Muslim person contributing to americanAmerican society.
Isn't that what makes the US special?
Isn't that what they call the American Dream?
It is never too late to fulfill dreams.
Not even for my uncle Amir.
If he achieves to get over his problems and starts all over again, even he can find happiness once more.
Oh, Tariq just called me.
I'm sure that he would join me in fighting for our future.
This might even be the best idea of my life, as it could change everything.
